conclusion: The square conductor frame has a side length l, the magnetic field has a width d, the frame moves with a constant speed v, and the condition given is l < d.
An induced current occurs when the frame is partially or fully inside the magnetic field.
The frame will experience an induced current when it enters the magnetic field and when it exits the magnetic field.
The time taken for the frame to enter the magnetic field completely is l/v.
The time taken for the frame to exit the magnetic field completely is l/v.
The total time during which the frame is partially or fully inside the magnetic field is the time it takes for the frame to move a distance d.
The time taken for the frame to move a distance d is d/v.
The time during which there is an induced current in the frame is d/v.
